questions.q: In which layer of the networking model are TCP and UDP found?
questions.explanation: TCP and UDP are two key components in the Transport Layer [1].

questions.q: What does TCP stand for?
questions.explanation: TCP stands for Transmission Control Protocol [2].

questions.q: What does UDP stand for?
questions.explanation: UDP stands for User Datagram Protocol [3].

questions.q: Which protocol is connection-based and ensures reliability?
questions.explanation: TCP is a connection-based protocol that ensures reliable data exchange [1].

questions.q: Which protocol is connectionless and prioritizes speed?
questions.explanation: UDP is a connectionless protocol that prioritizes speed and efficiency [1, 2].

questions.q: True or False: TCP is generally faster than UDP.
questions.explanation: TCP is described as a slow communication protocol compared to UDP [2].

questions.q: Why is TCP considered more reliable than UDP?
questions.explanation: TCP is more reliable due to features such as sequencing, flow control, and error checking [2].
options: It includes features like sequencing, flow control, and error checking
It never sends data over the internet
It only works with fiber optic cables

questions.q: What happens in TCP when a server receives a packet of information?
questions.explanation: When a server receives a packet, it provides a confirmation of reception to the sender [3].
options: It provides a confirmation of that packet's reception to the sender
It sends the packet to a different server
It ignores the packet until all other packets arrive

questions.q: In TCP, when does the sender transmit the second packet of information?
questions.explanation: When the sender receives confirmation from the server for the first packet, it sends the second one [3].
options: When it receives confirmation for the first packet from the server
After a fixed timer of 10 seconds
Only if the first packet was lost

questions.q: Which protocol is best suited for instant messaging apps like WhatsApp?
questions.explanation: TCP is used in text communication like WhatsApp because missing parts are not tolerated [2].

questions.q: Which protocol is used for time-sensitive tasks like online gaming?
questions.explanation: UDP is a communication protocol for time-sensitive tasks like online gaming [3].

questions.q: True or False: UDP accepts occasional packet loss.
questions.explanation: UDP prioritizes speed and efficiency, accepting occasional packet loss [2].

questions.q: Does TCP always send data parts in chronological order?
questions.explanation: TCP doesn't always send parts chronologically; they can be mixed up [3].
options: No, they can be mixed up, but the receiver reassembles them
It only sends data in reverse order
It only sends one packet at a time manually

questions.q: Which protocol prioritizes data integrity over speed?
questions.explanation: TCP is crucial for applications prioritizing data integrity [1].

questions.q: What is a major feature of TCP that ensures the server received the data?
questions.explanation: Every received packet of information in TCP is confirmed by the server [2].
options: Every received packet is confirmed by the server

questions.q: Which of the following is an example of a UDP application?
questions.explanation: UDP is used for time-sensitive tasks like media streaming [3].

questions.q: True or False: In TCP, it is impossible for information to go missing because of confirmation features.
questions.explanation: Because every packet is confirmed, it is considered impossible for information to go missing in TCP [2].

questions.q: Which protocol is described as 'connectionless'?
questions.explanation: UDP is a connectionless protocol [2].

questions.q: Which protocol is described as 'connection-based'?
questions.explanation: TCP is a connection-based protocol [1].

questions.q: TCP sequencing helps the receiver to:
questions.explanation: Sequencing is a feature that allows the receiver to handle parts that are not sent chronologically [2, 3].

questions.q: True or False: UDP provides flow control.
questions.explanation: Flow control is specifically listed as a feature of TCP reliability [2].

questions.q: Choosing the right protocol (TCP or UDP) influences which of the following?
questions.explanation: Choosing the right protocol influences performance, data integrity, and user experience [1].

questions.q: TCP is a standard that enables application programs to exchange ________ over a network.
questions.explanation: TCP enables application programs and computing devices to exchange messages [2].

questions.q: If occasional packet loss is acceptable for the sake of efficiency, which protocol should be used?
questions.explanation: UDP accepts occasional packet loss to prioritize speed and efficiency [2].

questions.q: In text communication, why is TCP preferred over UDP?
questions.explanation: In text apps, discrepancies are not tolerated, hence TCP is used to receive the full message without parts missing [2].
options: Any discrepancy or missing part is not tolerated

questions.q: Essay: Define the primary difference between TCP and UDP as stated in Lecture 9.
questions.explanation: Source: [1, 2]
questions.answer: TCP is connection-based and reliable (ensuring data integrity), while UDP is connectionless and prioritizes speed/efficiency (accepting packet loss).

questions.q: Which protocol is more likely to be used for a VOIP (Voice over IP) call?
questions.explanation: VOIP is time-sensitive, similar to online gaming and streaming, making it a candidate for UDP [3].

questions.q: True or False: TCP and UDP both operate at the Network Layer.
questions.explanation: They are two key components in the Transport Layer [1].

questions.q: What is 'error checking' in the context of TCP?
questions.explanation: TCP is more reliable due to features such as sequencing, flow control, and error checking [2].
options: A way to speed up the network
A feature that contributes to reliability
A process that deletes random packets
A tool for counting hop counts

questions.q: True or False: UDP is used for applications where data integrity is the top priority.
questions.explanation: TCP is crucial for applications prioritizing data integrity [1].

questions.q: How many protocols are identified as 'key components' of the Transport Layer in this lecture?
questions.explanation: TCP and UDP are identified as two key components in the Transport Layer [1].

questions.q: In the TCP exchange process, what 'goes on and on' until completion?
questions.explanation: The process of sending a packet and receiving confirmation continues until all packets are delivered successfully [3].
options: Sending a packet and receiving a confirmation

questions.q: True or False: User Datagram Protocol is a Communication standard.
questions.explanation: UDP is described as a communication protocol [3].

questions.q: Which protocol would you choose for a large file download where every bit must be correct?
questions.explanation: TCP ensures reliability and that no information goes missing, making it ideal for data integrity [2].

questions.q: True or False: UDP is connection-based.
questions.explanation: UDP is a connectionless protocol [2].

questions.q: Essay: List three features of TCP that make it reliable.
questions.explanation: Source: [2]
questions.answer: Sequencing, flow control, and error checking.

questions.q: In the context of the lecture, what does 'tolerated' refer to?
questions.explanation: The lecture states discrepancies in texting aren't tolerated, so TCP is used [2].
options: How much speed a user can stand
Whether discrepancies in text messages are allowed

questions.q: True or False: Media streaming uses TCP because speed is not important.
questions.explanation: Media streaming uses UDP because it is a time-sensitive task [3].

questions.q: What is the result of the TCP confirmation process?
questions.explanation: Reliability is achieved because every received packet is confirmed [2].

questions.q: Essay: Why is UDP called 'connectionless'?
questions.explanation: Source: [1, 2]
questions.answer: It does not establish a formal connection or confirm the reception of every packet, prioritizing speed instead.
